defs.docs: Terminal formatting library.

attributes.value: / Terminal formatting library.
/ This crate provides the `Terminal` trait, which abstracts over an [ANSI
/ Terminal][ansi] to provide color printing, among other things. There are two
/ implementations, the `TerminfoTerminal`, which uses control characters from
/ a [terminfo][ti] database, and `WinConsole`, which uses the [Win32 Console
/ API][win].
/ # Usage
/ This crate is [on crates.io](https://crates.io/crates/term) and can be
/ used by adding `term` to the dependencies in your project's `Cargo.toml`.
/ ```toml
/ [dependencies]
/ and this to your crate root:
/ ```rust
/ extern crate term;
/ # Examples
/ ```no_run
/ extern crate term;
/ use std::io::prelude::*;
/ fn main() {
/     let mut t = term::stdout().unwrap();
/     t.fg(term::color::GREEN).unwrap();
/     write!(t, "hello, ").unwrap();
/     t.fg(term::color::RED).unwrap();
/     writeln!(t, "world!").unwrap();
/     assert!(t.reset().unwrap());
/ [ansi]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code
/ [win]: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms682010%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
/ [ti]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terminfo
deny(missing_docs)

defs.docs: Expand a parameterized capability

attributes.value: / Expand a parameterized capability
/ # Arguments
/ * `cap`    - string to expand
/ * `params` - vector of params for %p1 etc
/ * `vars`   - Variables struct for %Pa etc
/ To be compatible with ncurses, `vars` should be the same between calls to `expand` for
/ multiple capabilities for the same terminal.

defs.name: Attr
defs.value:
pub enum Attr {
    Bold,
    Dim,
    Italic(bool),
    Underline(bool),
    Blink,
    Standout(bool),
    Reverse,
    Secure,
    ForegroundColor(color::Color),
    BackgroundColor(color::Color),
}
defs.docs: Terminal attributes for use with term.attr().

attributes.value: / Terminal attributes for use with term.attr().
/ Most attributes can only be turned on and must be turned off with term.reset().
/ The ones that can be turned off explicitly take a boolean value.
/ Color is also represented as an attribute for convenience.

defs.name: Terminal
defs.docs:
A terminal with similar capabilities to an ANSI Terminal
 (foreground/background colors etc).

attributes.value: / A terminal with similar capabilities to an ANSI Terminal
/ (foreground/background colors etc).

defs.docs: The terminal's output writer type.

attributes.value: / The terminal's output writer type.

defs.name: fg
defs.value: pub fn fg(&mut Self, color::Color) -> io::Result<bool>
defs.docs: Sets the foreground color to the given color.

attributes.value: / Sets the foreground color to the given color.
/ If the color is a bright color, but the terminal only supports 8 colors,
/ the corresponding normal color will be used instead.
/ Returns `Ok(true)` if the color was set, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)`
/ if there was an I/O error.

defs.name: bg
defs.value: pub fn bg(&mut Self, color::Color) -> io::Result<bool>
defs.docs: Sets the background color to the given color.

attributes.value: / Sets the background color to the given color.
/ If the color is a bright color, but the terminal only supports 8 colors,
/ the corresponding normal color will be used instead.
/ Returns `Ok(true)` if the color was set, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)`
/ if there was an I/O error.

defs.value: pub fn attr(&mut Self, Attr) -> io::Result<bool>
defs.docs:
Sets the given terminal attribute, if supported.  Returns `Ok(true)`
 if the attribute was supported, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)` if
 there was an I/O error.

attributes.value: / Sets the given terminal attribute, if supported.  Returns `Ok(true)`
/ if the attribute was supported, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)` if
/ there was an I/O error.

defs.name: supports_attr
defs.docs: Returns whether the given terminal attribute is supported.

attributes.value: / Returns whether the given terminal attribute is supported.

defs.name: reset
defs.docs: Resets all terminal attributes and colors to their defaults.

attributes.value: / Resets all terminal attributes and colors to their defaults.
/ Returns `Ok(true)` if the terminal was reset, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)` if there
/ was an I/O error.
/ *Note: This does not flush.*
/ That means the reset command may get buffered so, if you aren't planning on doing anything
/ else that might flush stdout's buffer (e.g. writing a line of text), you should flush after
/ calling reset.

defs.name: cursor_up
defs.docs: Moves the cursor up one line.

attributes.value: / Moves the cursor up one line.
/ Returns `Ok(true)` if the cursor was moved, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)`
/ if there was an I/O error.

defs.name: delete_line
defs.docs: Deletes the text from the cursor location to the end of the line.

attributes.value: / Deletes the text from the cursor location to the end of the line.
/ Returns `Ok(true)` if the text was deleted, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)`
/ if there was an I/O error.

defs.name: carriage_return
defs.docs: Moves the cursor to the left edge of the current line.

attributes.value: / Moves the cursor to the left edge of the current line.
/ Returns `Ok(true)` if the text was deleted, `Ok(false)` otherwise, and `Err(e)`
/ if there was an I/O error.
